hiringOrganization.name: California Institute Of Technology Jet Propulsion Laboratory

jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Will be a member of the Earth Science and Technology Directorate’s Business Administration Office and will report directly to the manager.  Will provide support to several program managers including the 830, 870, and GCE program managers.

Responsibilities Include but are not limited to:

  • Will be responsible for coordinating day-to-day activities for the program offices.  

  • Will arrange programmatic and conference travel, both domestic and foreign for program management.  

  • Will assist with leading sophisticated calendars, schedules, and meetings for senior managers. 

  • Will support remote meeting activities for the program offices, coordinate conference room logistics, and ensure equipment is operational, support multi-party, both domestic and international WebEx (voice/data/video) sessions. 

  • Will provide setup and hosting support for program office meetings, events, VIP visits, workshop and reviews. 

  • Will assist in the development and preparation of review materials and graphics for conferences, reports, and senior management reviews. 

  • Will assist with the significant events process, assist in coordinating and transmitting data for monthly and quarterly reviews, and maintaining associated web tools and data. Facilitate and coordinate with technical SMEs to effectively provide support (i.e with on-boarding and ensuring physical, JPL network, and data access).

  • Will be responsible for completing assignments that are discreet in nature and require considerable judgment and discretion. 

  • Will provide additional support to the program offices that includes answering phones, processing visitor requests (domestic and international), ordering and maintaining office supplies, and other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

  • Typically requires a High School diploma with a minimum of 10 years of related experience; Associates degree with a minimum of 6 years of related experience; or Bachelors degree with a minimum of 3 years of related experience; related required training. 

  • Sophisticated understanding of both general and detailed aspects of work techniques in the administrative assistant professions including knowledge of practical applications to problems and situations ordinarily encountered  in a administrative role. 

  • Advanced understanding of executive office processes and procedures and applied knowledge and skills in this area. 

  • Excellent planning and scheduling skills.  

  • Advanced composition and editing skills; excellent typing, spelling, and grammar. 

  • Excellent PC computer and MS Office skills proficiency in drafting original materials in Word, crafting Excel spreadsheets and PowerPoint presentation chart; experience accessing and updating electronic libraries and various data repositories. 

Preferred Skills:

  • Ability to work under pressure on multiple tasks, and work independently to meet commitments and deadlines, and deliver  high quality products. 

  • Extensive experience with domestic and foreign travel processes, applications, and regulations. 

  • Extensive experience with travel authorizations & expense reports; experience coordinating foreign travel forecasts. 

  • Extensive experience managing multiple/complex Outlook calendars.  Ability to harmonize with all levels of personnel; experience working with senior and executive management. 

  • Advanced understanding of applicable policies and procedures. 

  • Demonstrated ability handling confidential and sensitive information.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks

The hiring range displayed below is specifically for those who will work in or reside in the location listed. In extending an offer, Jet Propulsion Laboratory considers factors including, but not limited to, the candidate’s job related skills, experience, knowledge, and relevant education/training. Hiring range for this job may be adjusted based on primary work location outside of Pasadena, California. This adjusted range will be provided to candidates by the Recruiter when applicable.

The typical full time equivalent annual hiring range for this job in Pasadena, California.

$79,248 - $101,192

JPL is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy or perceived pregnancy, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, protected military or veteran status or any other characteristic or condition protected by Federal, state or local law.

In addition, JPL is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

EEO is the Law.

EEO is the Law Supplement

Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision

The Jet Propulsion Laboratory is a federal facility. Due to rules imposed by NASA, JPL will not accept applications from citizens of designated countries or those born in a designated country unless they are Legal Permanent Residents of the U.S or have other protected status under 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3). The Designated Countries List is available here.
